docs.snippet: HEYMAN--Lisa, age 47. Oscar Heyman & Brothers mourns the passing of our dear Lisa Heyman on February 25. Lisa will always be remembered as the devoted mother of Roxanne and Ruby, the cherished wife of Larry Gauchman, the beloved daughter of Barbar...
docs.lead_paragraph: HEYMAN--Lisa, age 47. Oscar Heyman & Brothers mourns the passing of our dear Lisa Heyman on February 25. Lisa will always be remembered as the devoted mother of Roxanne and Ruby, the cherished wife of Larry Gauchman, the beloved daughter of Barbara and Marvin, and the loving sister of Jonathan, Ben, and Ruth. We will always remember Lisa's warmth, humor, charm, and especially her devotion to family. Service at King David Cemetery, 101 Mill Street, Putnam Valley, NY, 11am, Wednesday, February 27. Donations to The Amyloidosis Foundation, 7151 North Main Street, Suite 208, Clarkston, Michigan, 48346. Shiva at the home of her husband, Larry, after the service until 7pm, Thursday 3-8pm, Saturday 6-8 pm, and on Sunday, at the home of her mother, Barbara, 3-8pm.

docs.snippet: Boxer, gold medalist, pop singer, fight promoter Oscar De La Hoya may add Major League Soccer team owner to his resume....

docs.snippet: The Oscars are over. But are they also over -- as in passé?...
docs.lead_paragraph: Throughout his personal and professional life, the Bagger has made a habit of showing up right when a particular cultural phenomenon was about to crash. He went to a Yippie camp-in in 1974. Do the math: the war was over and Nixon was on his way out. And he didn't get punk until it was more about fashion than music.
docs.abstract: The Oscars are over. But are they also over -- as in passé?

docs.snippet: With the writers' strike settled, the stars were back in Hollywood on Sunday for the 80th annual Academy Awards, but many viewers stayed away. Nielsen's ratings estimates suggest that the Oscars telecast on ABC attracted significantly fewer viewer...
docs.lead_paragraph: With the writers' strike settled, the stars were back in Hollywood on Sunday for the 80th annual Academy Awards, but many viewers stayed away. Nielsen's ratings estimates suggest that the Oscars telecast on ABC attracted significantly fewer viewers than in recent years, falling short of the previous all-time low set in 2003, when the ceremony coincided with the start of the war in Iraq. Although final ratings were not expected to be released before Tuesday, Nielsen's time-zone adjusted ratings showed the live telecast earned an average of 32 million viewers, down from 33 million in 2003. Last year the Oscars averaged 39.9 million viewers.
docs.abstract: Nielsen ratings estimates suggest that Oscars telecast on ABC attracted significantly fewer viewers than in recent years, falling short of previous all-time low set in 2003 (M)

headline.main: No Night for Big Ratings: Oscar Flirts With an All-Time Low
